sub_title: Assistant Professor at University of Twente
summary:
I am a Chemical-Mechanical Engineer with a focused expertise in Hydrogen Energy Systems, boasting over 15 years of extensive, multidimensional experience across four countries. I hold a Ph.D. in Mechanical Engineering from Ontario Tech University, where my research in photoelectrochemical hydrogen production in multigeneration systems sparked my passion for sustainable energy solutions.

My academic journey spans multiple disciplines, from developing complex metal hydride-based hydrogen storage systems to advising on sustainability matters in waste management and material conservation. Currently, I hold a role at the University of Twente, focusing on hydrogen's role in energy transition.

My work has been recognized with numerous accolades, including the Governor-General of Canada's Gold Medal for Academic Excellence and the Outstanding Young Scientist Award from the Turkish Academy of Sciences.

My current research focus centers on integrating renewable-based hydrogen energy systems across various sectors, aiming to design adaptive, efficient, and resilient energy networks for the future. My mission is to drive innovative solutions for our global energy challenges, paving the way toward a sustainable and low-carbon future.
